title: Mission Description
content: The failure ofPhainon'sCoreflametrial means the responsibility of bearingNikador's divinity now falls to the lone crown prince ofKremnos— you. Yet, even as the orthodox heir to "Strife," you seem to have an absurd extent of hesitation and objection to accepting the god's authority...

text: At the same time, on the other side of Marmoreal Palace

speaker: Tribbie
line: Don't worry, De. This isn't the first time he's been like this. A long time ago—

speaker: Mydei
line: I'm not worrying about him.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Oh... Alright. You're a little quiet, though.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...I'm sorry, that was rude of me. What I meant was, I know that man can pull through for sure.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Hehe, it's alright! Being straightforward suits you better.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Actually, De, there's something we are curious about... What did you see in Nikador 's trial?

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Something that terrifies me.

speaker: Mydei
line: Isn't that ironic? There shouldn't even be a word for "fear" in the Kremnoan language.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Do you think... you stand a chance? Against that thing that terrifies you?

speaker: Mydei
line: Is this also part of your grand scheme?

speaker: Tribbie
line: What do you mean?

speaker: Mydei
line: Aglaea knew that Phainon might fall...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...And she expected me to take his place. That was the plan all along, wasn't it?

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Yes. Looks like you know everything.

speaker: Mydei
line: I have no intention of condemning you for it. The Flame-Chase Journey is not a game, and I have long understood this.

speaker: Mydei
line: With the downfall of Strife and the ever-growing threat that the black tide poses, if Cerces and Oronyx are also impacted, the ramifications will be dire.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Mm-hmm. They are the only two Titans who are still lucid and willing to coexist with humanity.

speaker: Mydei
line: Regrettably, I do not hold the key to completing the trial. If I wish to conquer that fear, I need the assistance of my fellow Kremnoans.

speaker: Mydei
line: Give me some time to speak with my people... It won't take long, I promise.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Ah, I see — there is strength in numbers. But you must know that the trial to become a demigod is ultimately meant for only one individual.

speaker: Tribbie
line: De, your people... They have been eagerly awaiting a new king all this time, haven't they?

speaker: Tribbie
line: If you take on the divine role, they will have no reservations about following your lead... After all, you're the hero of Castrum Kremnos.

speaker: Mydei
line: I once was. But Lady Tribios...

speaker: Mydei
line: Therein lies my deepest fear .

speaker: Mydei
line: ...We'll talk again later. I'll be back.

speaker: Tribbie
line: De.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hm?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Regardless of what happens, we will always be there for you.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Thank you.

text: Head to the hot bath and look for the Kremnoans

speaker: Mydei
line: (The person I'm looking for is probably in the hot bath. I should go take a look... The billowing steam always brings back memories of the furnaces in our homeland.)

speaker: Tribbie
line: Regardless of what happens, we will always be there for you.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Thank you.

speaker: Mydei
line: (Children left unattended by their parents? That's not safe.)

speaker: Mydei
line: You shouldn't run around in here, kids.

speaker: Demetri
line: Hey, it's the crown prince! Are you also here for a bath?

speaker: Castrum Kremnos Children
line: Oh, the prince has arrived! / What a lucky day! / I want to hear your tales from the battlefield!

speaker: Mydei
line: The crown prince...? Are you Kremnoans?

speaker: Andriskos
line: Yeah, we are! The grown-ups said we used to live next to the arena! ...Well, next to the parts next to it anyway!

speaker: Marsyas
line: My dad is a centurion with the Hydra Lancers, and my mom is the bravest warrior in the Godshield Brigade. We used to get tons of silver coins from Mr. Krateros !

speaker: Demetri
line: My parents are serving in the Holy City Garrison now. As warriors of Kremnos, they're braver than any Okheman !

speaker: Mydei
line: Why are you kids here alone? Where are the grown-ups?

speaker: Marsyas
line: Hee-hee, Mom and Dad were asleep, so we snuck out to play hide-and-seek with Mr. Krateros!

speaker: Mydei
line: That old man can be such a child sometimes... Do you know where Krateros is? I happen to be looking for him.

speaker: Marsyas
line: Sorry, I don't. Come to think of it, we haven't seen him in a while. Did he get lost while trying to find us?

speaker: Andriskos
line: No way! Mr. Krateros is a member of the Royal Wing Elites . He's the best at hunting down enemies!

speaker: Andriskos
line: He was counting near Verax Leo when we went to hide. I thought about taking a peek, but who knows if it might be a trap he set?

speaker: Mydei
line: It was prudent of you to be cautious. So, which Verax Leo was he with?

speaker: Andriskos
line: It's... Um, just take a few turns after you go out from here... It's close to the baths!

speaker: Mydei
line: Alright, I'll go look for him. You should consider the game over and head home for now. And don't play around the hot baths again!

speaker: Demetri
line: Wait, Your Highness!

speaker: Mydei
line: Is there something else?

speaker: Demetri
line: I heard you retrieved Nikador's Coreflame...

speaker: Demetri
line: Does that mean... we get to go back home soon?

speaker: Mydei
line: Have you ever been to Castrum Kremnos?

speaker: Mydei
line: You were all born in the holy city and are living lives no different from the Okhemans. Everything you know about our people comes only from the tales of others.

speaker: Mydei
line: You have never even witnessed that blade in the sky with your own eyes... How, then, is a city you have never seen your home?

speaker: Demetri
line: Because this place is definitely not home.

speaker: Demetri
line: Mom and Dad told me that the children of Kremnos are born to wield swords and fight on the battlefield.

speaker: Andriskos
line: They also said that the Kremnoan detachment led by the crown prince is the bravest army across all of Amphoreus . No one can defeat them!

speaker: Marsyas
line: The kids in the holy city don't play with us. The moment they find out that our parents are Kremnoans, they shun us...

speaker: Marsyas
line: But we don't care. We all know that the crown prince will take us home one day!

speaker: Mydei
line: That time has not yet arrived, but... Young men of Kremnos, heed my command! Return to your parents at once. From hereon, you are to dedicate yourselves to rigorous training and a healthy diet. You must not neglect these two aspects if you are to become a brave warrior of Kremnos.

speaker: Mydei
line: Only by following this path can you be deemed worthy of returning home.

speaker: Castrum Kremnos Children
line: Yes, Your Highness!

title: Step Description
content: Seeing the energetic Kremnoan children prompts you to reflect on Castrum Kremnos's future. You decide to seek out the Kremnoan veteran Krateros for a discussion.

speaker: Mydei
line: (The future of Kremnos... I should find Krateros.)

speaker: Mydei
line: (There he is. Is he engaged in a debate with that foolish lion?)

speaker: Distressed Soldier
line: Drat! It's the crown prince of Castrum Kremnos...

speaker: Scouting Soldier
line: Get a grip! We're here by order of the Council of Elders . Even the Chrysos Heirs have to think twice before doing anything to us.

speaker: Mydei
line: Out of my way, lackeys of the Council.

speaker: Distressed Soldier
line: Uh...

speaker: Scouting Soldier
line: Th—The Civil Guard of Okhema is on official duty. Please keep out of this area!

speaker: Verax Leo
line: Calm down, my lord. Play nice...

speaker: Mydei
line: Don't make me repeat myself.

speaker: Scouting Soldier
line: I—I'll allow you to pass this time... but just this once!

speaker: Krateros
line: So, you think yourself knowledgeable? Then here is a question for you: Do you know how Chryseus Leo in Castrum Kremnos came to be mounted on the wall?

speaker: Verax Leo
line: I—I don't know, my lord, ahaha... How did it come to be?

speaker: Krateros
line: Hahaha! Let me enlighten you. A long time ago, the founder of Castrum Kremnos led a group of warriors to hunt down a lion on the outskirts of the city of Tretos .

speaker: Krateros
line: That vicious beast had been a menace for years, and the bones in its den were stacked even higher than the peaks around Okhema.

speaker: Krateros
line: But do you know what happened? Nary a moment had passed after the beast's head peeked out of its den when the Kremnoan warriors surged forward and brought it down within the blink of an eye, shattering its knees with a single strike! And then—

speaker: Krateros
line: ...Why are you red-faced already? We haven't even gotten to the best part yet!

speaker: Verax Leo
line: I—It's your storytelling, my lord. You're weaving such a captivating tale that it got my blood pumping. Please, go on...

speaker: Verax Leo
line: — Well, well. If it isn't Lord Mydei! It's been a while, ahaha...

speaker: Krateros
line: Oho, what in Okhema is happening?

speaker: Krateros
line: To what do I owe the pleasure, son of Gorgo ?

speaker: Mydei
line: Krateros... My esteemed teacher.

speaker: Krateros
line: Let's talk somewhere else, Mydeimos. I'm tired of speaking with this silly lion.

speaker: Mydei
line: What about the Council's informants?

speaker: Krateros
line: Those two hyenas are nothing but scavengers of rotten meat. They couldn't bite even if they tried.

speaker: Krateros
line: They can follow us if they want to. Let's go.

speaker: Verax Leo
line: Wait, so how in the world did Chryseus Leo get mounted on the wall!?

text: Follow Krateros to a quiet corner...

speaker: Krateros
line: Keep up with us, you hyen... oh, sorry, I meant officers.

speaker: Scouting Soldier
line: Hey, old man, how dare you—

speaker: Distressed Soldier
line: Calm down, calm down!

text: (Trying to move away from the objective, optional)

speaker: Krateros
line: Seems like the son of Gorgo has a poor sense of direction, huh?

speaker: Krateros
line: Don't fall behind now... unless you want to upset our friends here.

speaker: Distressed Soldier
line: D—Don't you dare try any tricks with us...!

speaker: Krateros
line: We're almost there.

speaker: Scouting Soldier
line: ...Wh—Why have you stopped?

speaker: Krateros
line: This is a nice spot for a private chat.

speaker: Mydei
line: Shall we, sir?

speaker: Krateros
line: Let's do it!

speaker: Distressed Soldier
line: Wh—What are you up to!?

speaker: Scouting Soldier
line: S—Someone! Help m—

speaker: Krateros
line: Hmph... Some privacy at last.

speaker: Krateros
line: So, tell me, why have you come to seek this old man's counsel?

speaker: Mydei
line: I came to discuss... the future of the Kremnoans.

speaker: Krateros
line: Interesting. I heard the Coreflame of the Lance of Fury has been restored — though not by your hand — and you're even considering giving up Nikador's divine power. Is this true?

speaker: Mydei
line: Those rumors are not entirely groundless.

speaker: Krateros
line: In other words... you did entertain the thought of giving up the throne of Kremnos and forsaking your people.

speaker: Mydei
line: The divine power is not equivalent to the throne. The path of Strife is also not our people's only way—

speaker: Krateros
line: ...Enough with the word games! You, of all people, should understand the plight of the Kremnoans!

speaker: Krateros
line: Think about all the warriors of the Kremnoan detachment who left their homeland with you! Think about their children! ...Only the yearning for our former glory days has kept us going all this time.

speaker: Krateros
line: If they ever learn that the crown prince they look up to so much is actually toying with the notion of stepping down... think of the disgrace it would bring upon your departed mother, Mydeimos.

speaker: Krateros
line: You'd best remember that she died for you because of Eurypon 's schemes! To restore the glory of Kremnos!

speaker: Mydei
line: Since you've brought that up... Tell me, who is responsible for my father's death?

speaker: Krateros
line: Are you trying to shame me, Mydeimos? I may be old, but I haven't become so decrepit that I've forgotten it all. Of course I remember that Eurypon died when the Kremnoan detachment surrounded him.

speaker: Krateros
line: You drove the spear into his chest with your very own hands.

speaker: Mydei
line: That was merely the final outcome.

speaker: Mydei
line: Do you still not see it? What led my parents and our people to their downfall is none other than this Strife we speak of. The quest for glory, the tenet of "Valorous Death Before Glorious Return"...

speaker: Mydei
line: This is the creed of every Kremnoan, no matter whether these beliefs are justified or not.

speaker: Krateros
line: Don't be ridiculous. The only thing that could slay a king is a spear... Even an infant knows that much.

speaker: Krateros
line: I swore to your mother that I would guard your crown with my life... I never foresaw that the son of Gorgo himself would be the first to turn his back on the Kremnoan spirit.

speaker: Krateros
line: Gorgo... Your mother bore that name, the name of the great founder of Castrum Kremnos, and she upheld that name with honor. If you choose to turn your back on her legacy like a wretched deserter... do not fault me for withholding my loyalty, Mydeimos.

speaker: Mydei
line: I came to discuss the future of our people with you, but... it appears this is not the right time yet.

speaker: Krateros
line: Go, Mydei... Hah, that's what those Chrysos Heirs call you, isn't it? Go down the path you have deemed correct. Deep down, you have always been one to do as you please, and I am well aware that no one can deter you once you've made up your mind.

speaker: Krateros
line: But don't you ever dream of renouncing the traditions of Kremnos... We may reside in Okhema now, but we remain eternally bound to Strife by blood.

speaker: Mydei
line: Bloodlines no longer hold any significance in this era of destruction.

speaker: Krateros
line: My young lord, always bear this in mind: Never reveal your vulnerabilities to anyone. A lion should never dwell amidst its prey...

speaker: Krateros
line: ...Especially when it wields power enough to dominate the entire hunting ground.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Eurypon, the boy did nothing wrong!

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: This is murder! Do not sully the noble name of Kremnos with the blood of an innocent child! You mustn't reveal your weaknesses to the enemy!

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: Enough! My decision is final. We must use this child's life to preserve the soul of the great Nikador .

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: We must... save Castrum Kremnos.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Don't be absurd! Those tiny hands lack the strength to even lift a spear! Do you truly believe him a threat to Castrum Kremnos!?

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: You'll be ending the bloodline of Kremnos if you do this. Our millennia-old glory will become nothing more than a joke!

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: Have you forgotten that we Kremnoans place no value in bloodlines? It is through pure bloodshed and slaughter that the kings of Kremnos have ascended to the throne...

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: As for our millennia-old "glory"... it has always been a joke in my eyes. Glorify it all you want, but it will not alter the nature of slaughter. Those who revel in it are but murderers. They are no more noble than the most monstrous beasts in Amphoreus.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Enough with your words! Among all the kings of Kremnos, which one did not inherit the crown only after plucking it from the lifeless body of his father?

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: But listen to yourself now! Do you truly believe you can cleanse the blood from your hands through mere words alone?

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: Nay, quite the contrary. I will end this cycle of bloodshed...

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: ...Starting with this child. With these bloodstained hands, I will end it all.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Your failure is inevitable, Eurypon! You are just a coward who can only raise his blade against his own child! A beast that murders his own kin!

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Royal Wing Elites and Ephors of Kremnos, you cannot sit idly by and watch this atrocity unfold! If you consider yourselves the honorable sons and daughters of Gorgo , then take up your spears and join me in putting an end to this bloody charade!

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: ...Does anyone else have any objections? If so, come forward with your spear and prove your mettle!

speaker: Magistrate
line: ...Understood.

speaker: Magistrate
line: Five...

speaker: Magistrate
line: Four...

speaker: Magistrate
line: Three...

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: No one dares stand by my side? Cowards! Has that crown stripped you of your courage!?

speaker: Magistrate
line: Two...

speaker: Magistrate
line: One.

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: It appears there are no objections. Then, in accordance with the Kremnoan Council's principle of tacit consent, the decision is final.

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: With all present as witnesses, this child shall descend into the Sea of Souls, where he will nourish the Lance of Fury and join the fallen heroes.

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: May fate and the gods await your arrival...

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: My son... Mydeimos.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Stop!

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: If you have more to say, then speak. On account of the life we have shared together, I grant you this one final chance.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: With the Blade of Fury above us and the Council bearing witness, I, Gorgo, hereby move to challenge the crown in accordance with the laws of Kremnos!

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: O unworthy king, in the name of the Council of Elders, I demand that you duel me!

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: Heh... Very well.

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: We shall see who the Kremnoan blade strikes down.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Mydeimos, my son...

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: They all tell me to forget... But how could I ever?

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: The son of Gorgo ... will be crowned in blood.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: If there is no Kremnos without the crown... then I shall seize the crown and smash it to pieces to bring the people to their senses.

text: Only the cries and the waves of the Sea of Souls echoed.
When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
